Is Windows failing to boot after you installed the loader? Just do the following.

* Boot up the PC from your Windows installation disk
* Select the "Repair your computer" option
* Select "Command Prompt"
* Input "bootsect.exe /nt60 SYS /force" (without quotes)
* Restart the PC

Note: If the above doesn't fix your boot issue then use the command "bootsect.exe /nt60 ALL /force" instead. Just make sure you remove all USB flash drives before you use the command.

***WARNING***
This will work but you must repair the bootsector for you computer to work after the restart (in 50% of cases). Before restarting goto the start menu, type cmd and enter the following: bootsect.exe /nt60 SYS /force
then restart your computer. If it still doesn't work and gives you the boot compressed error you will need an install cd of windows or another way to access the dos prompt to continue.

Is Windows failing to boot after you installed the loader? Just do the following.

* Boot up the PC from your Windows installation disk
* Select the "Repair your computer" option
* Select "Command Prompt"
* If command prompt is not an option goto recover then cancel and it should pop up as an option
* Input "bootsect.exe /nt60 SYS /force" (without quotes)
* Restart the PC
